Pre-Game Insights: The Milwaukee Brewers (76-56) are on their way to Great American Ball Park on Saturday where they will take on the Cincinnati Reds (63-70).
The expected starting pitchers are Frankie Montas for the Brewers and Carson Spiers for the Reds.
Milwaukee has a slugging percentage of .404 and have struck out 1,162 times, while being walked on 493 occasions.
The Brewers have accumulated 605 runs batted in as well as 1,127 base knocks so far this season, and their batting average comes in at .253.
As a team, the Milwaukee Brewers are knocking in 4.8 runs per game, which puts them at 9th in MLB.
The Brewers are sitting with a team earned run average of 3.70 for the year (3rd in baseball), and their staff has struck out 1,073 batters.
The Cincinnati Reds are sitting with an on-base percentage of .304 and a team batting average of .232 on the campaign.
Cincinnati has hit 154 home runs so far this year as well as 563 runs batted in.
The Reds have a team SLG% of .399 and they are earning 4.47 runs per game (15th in the league).
The Cincinnati pitching staff have given up 569 runs this season while having an ERA of 4.09 (532 earned runs surrendered).
